conclusion: Understand the initial setup and movement of objects A and B onto the location of objects C, D, E, and F.
There are two chairs on the table, each with a pillow (C, D) on one side and no pillow on the other side. There is also an empty seat (E, F).
Objects A and B are initially located in the empty seats (E and F).
Objects A and B are moved to the locations where the pillows are currently situated (C and D).
Once A and B are placed at their new positions (C and D), they will come into contact with the surfaces of the pillows due to gravity.
The pillows (C and D) will now have two additional objects resting on them, one from each chair.
Chair 1 (left): Pillow on one side, empty on the other.
Chair 2 (right): Pillow on one side, empty on the other.
Object A is initially in the empty seat of Chair 1.
Object B is initially in the empty seat of Chair 2.
Move Object A to the pillow side of Chair 1 (location C).
Move Object B to the pillow side of Chair 2 (location D).
As A and B are placed onto the pillows (C and D), they will settle under the influence of gravity.
The pillows (C and D) will experience additional weight on one side.
Pillows C and D will now have two objects (A and B) resting on them.

When objects A and B are placed at the locations of objects C and D respectively, they will come into contact with objects C and D because of gravity, and the pillows C and D will have two objects resting on them.
